Reviews.Title: “comfortable, clean and close to attractions”
Reviews.Author: Judy F
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the dunes. The rooms were very clean and the clerks were extremely friendly and helpful. There is a restaurant and lounge on location and the food was very good and the people very friendly. I would stay here again and hope to do so in the future. I'm glad we picked the dunes for our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the new room”
Reviews.Author: luistorres1975
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the dunes inn sunset and i loved the room renovation. Plenty of room and the bathrooms is a big upgrade. I will stay there again for sure. Great rates too and it is within minutes from the heart of Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “COMFORTABLE, GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Krisboy77
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at Dunes Inn Sunset, 21 and 22 March 2012, having found it on the internet. The hotel is very comfortable, with great beds ( my most important measurement) and bathrooms. The internt worked fine. The staff were very friendly and helpful. It was a good location for me in west Hollywood - close to shopping places I needed to visit, and restaurant Bossa Nova, they I like very much. Highly recommended, and very affordable. Chris Boylan, Sydney, Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, close to amenities, nice room.”
Reviews.Author: Neata_Skeeter
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here. Room was clean, bathroom was in working order, it was a close walk to the bus stop, there was a 7-11, a Burger King and a Denny's nearby for emergencies and staff were pretty pleasant (though the man on desk when we checked out didn't seem all that interested in us at all, he made it a very quick, easy check out) Would we stay here again? If the rates were as low as they were when we stayed? Yes we would.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, very clean and very helpful front desk”
Reviews.Author: hilarity1628
Reviews.Content: We arrived tired and stressed but the welcome at the desk could not have been better. We had booked for 2 nights and were given a choice of ground or first floor room and chose the latter, which had been refurbished. It was v.clean, the bed excellent, the bathroom also clean and bright. The Dreams restaurant was very good value and the waitress (? Dora) was friendly, helpful and welcoming. It was a shame that this was closed over the weekend, but ample alternatives close by. The guys at reception were more than happy to look after our luggage after we had booked out and also booked a taxi for us to LAX. Altogether a great start to our round the world trip. Happy to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good room, great location, bad front desk!”
Reviews.Author: keljam731
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Dunes Inn on Sunset Boulevard for 3 nights. We were a little worried about the security of the room considering it is across the road from a home depot store and we noticed a lot of people lingering around the area when we checked in, but we had no issues. Upon checkin we were given our room keys and the tv remote (you had to return it upon check out). Once we got in the room we were pleasently suprised at the size given the price, big open style bathroom with the option of shower head or hand held, a fridge at no extra cost, and a comfy bed and clean, one thing it was missing was an alarm clock. The location is a little bit further than expected to get to the hot spots in Hollywood, but considering we were there for 3 nights and going to Downtown LA for the basketball for 2 of those nights we didnt really mind. The only downfall we had was from the attitude from one of the people at the front desk. Checkout is not until 11am, and considering we were leaving for Australia that day we wanted to use all our time wisley as our flight was not until 10:45pm that same day so we wanted to be organised. At about 10:30am we got a call from the front desk asking us why we hadn't checked out yet, then we got told that checkout was at 11am which we already knew. My fiance had rang the front desk the previous day and asked if it was okay for us to store our luggage there and had explained that we had 4 big suitcases (LA was our last stop on a month trip to america) and our flight was later, they had told us that there would be no problem storing our bags there and were quite nice about it, until we checked out. We handed back our keys and the tv remote to the rude person (not the same person my fiance was talking to the previous day) and then asked if we could store our bags, he looked at us blankly and said "theres no room, we already have too many bags", we explained that we called the day earlier and they said it was fine. He replied with an attitude like it was too much hassle and asked us how long our bags would be there for, then proceeded to open the door and told us "well come on, im not going to carry your bags for you", we didnt expect him to anyway we were just waiting for him to tell us where to put them.

Reviews.Title: “Great room excellent bed”
Reviews.Author: Sas2744
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the dunes inn on sunset blvd, I was a bit apprehensive about this hotel prior to trip but was pleasantly surprised, the newly refurbished rooms were terrific, as I've a bad back beds are always a worry but the new beds were so good firm but with a pillow top that cushioned the back perfectly, the owners are in the process of revamping all the rooms, the hotel isn't new but money value you won't do better, I also liked the idea of an on site restaurant which offered a good variety from not so healthy to healthy prices were good, and room service was available, they also had a lounge and being close to 7 eleven and a couple of other handy shops, it was also serviced with public transport and pickup for tours, so don't expect the ritz but you won't do better for a comfy bed, clean room, room service and a handy restaurant, I would go back without hesitation the owners were welcoming and very easy to talk to.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel my family ever experienced”
Reviews.Author: Ron B
Reviews.Content: The smell in the room was not healthy, the bathroom was full of dirt in the cormers, the matress had a big brown spot and we stopped wondering what it might have been. The beds were full of bed bugs and after 6 weeks my wife and daughter still have dozens of red spots all over her body. The fat reception employee is absolutely not willing to put any effort in helping people. The location looks great but we were advised not to enter the street after sunset. I strongly recommend to never to book a room in this horrible hotel. Even the cheapest jungle hotels on Sumatra (Indonesia) we slept in had higher standards.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever stayed in, bed bugs all over the place!”
Reviews.Author: EricvdMeer
Reviews.Content: When you're used to sleep in the subway this hotel will be your choice, almost identical! Bed bugs are all over the place, we stayed here for only one night but even that was too long for us. For over 2 or 3 days after our stay in this hotel we were itching. Horrible experience we never hope to experience again! Stay out of this hotel, and maybe even stay out of Los Angeles,... there are better places in California to stay. Drive a little more southern to Carlsbad for example, much beter hotels and great ocean view. We'll never visit Los Angeles again, crime city #1 in our opinion. Too bad we didn't make foto's of the room, so you could see for yourself this is horrific.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent accommodation”
Reviews.Author: RongotaiApartments
Reviews.Content: We had a good stay at Dunes on Sunset, the location was absolutely brilliant - Sunset Boulevard! Short drive to Hollywood, Beverly Hills and Santa Monica. The room was clean, bedding was ok. 24 reception is helpful, nice easy motel accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place To Stay If you dont want to spend too much”
Reviews.Author: imshrey
Reviews.Content: It wasnt bad at all.I enjoyed my stay at dunes inn sunset.The Main thing is-The Location,it was perfect.Very near the Hollywood/Western Metro Station.Though The place was'nt really fancy,but it was decent and the rooms were basic.My room had a fridge,a microwave and a basic channel tv.So i think for the price i paid,i got a good deal,not great but satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “Great Quality”
Reviews.Author: ramsfan79
Reviews.Content: Dunes Inn - I've really enjoyed my stay @ the Dunes Inn room was very comfortable and resemble price hotel staff was excellent maids were very helpful with extra towels each day area was excellent very peaceful restaurant was excellent food price was fair for great food served waitress Dora very helpful young-lady yes i would return to this hotel - Mr Garcia

Reviews.Title: “The Terrible Dunes”
Reviews.Author: Bunnyhop55
Reviews.Content: Needed a hotel close to a taping of a Dr. Phil show. We chose this hotel based on the photo's on the internet. When we checked in and got to the room much to our surprise it was very run down the paint was peeling off the walls of the bathroom. The shower door rail was rusty and hard to close. The shower head was so short that I had to bend down and backwards just to get wet. One of the lamps did not work, asked for an early wake up call which never came. Thank God we had a small alarm clock with us. The TV only had a handful of channels most were in Spanish. Needed an iron the front desk they did supply one but did not work to well. This is a no frills hotel. Stay at your own risk.

Reviews.Title: “Hollwood on the cheap”
Reviews.Author: MetmanSouthend
Reviews.Content: Booked this one for proximity and price based on lonely planet guide.On first view it looked basic and slightly run down.However although showing its age it was clean and tidy.Bedrooms were small and bedding clean but typical horrid motel style.Bathroom was worn and small, shower pretty rubbish but worked just. Shower doors totally past sell by date .Car parking inside free and close to rooms a bonus!! and we had no problems with getting about from this location.Underground train is just a block away and easy to find.Attached cafe is fine with good service and friendly staff.For price v location I suspect this as good as it gets for $78 for a twin double..

Reviews.Title: “A Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: Murall
Reviews.Content: I needed to stay an extra night in LA and dropped by this motel whilst driving past. I thought it was a good deal for $78. The room was comfortable with a good quality bed; the bathroom a bit dated but most importantly very clean. I get very picky when it comes to cleanliness. The retaurant served a good breakfast and you get a discount as a hotel resident. Free parking right outside the room is a bonus. Having read the reviews of the cheaper hotels in the hollywood area I was a bit doubtful about finding a nice enough place, but I was very happy with Dunes and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Disatisfied with Dunes”
Reviews.Author: cybermac
Reviews.Content: Looking for a motel in close proximity to TV taping of a Dr. Phil show, we chose the Dunes on Sunset Blvd in West Hollywood. Although the property displayed the AAA emblem, it certainly left a lot to be desired. There were chips & scrapes on the bottom of the door frame in the bathroom and the lotion containers were half full--apparently not replaced by housekeeping. We needed an early wakeup call, but couldn't use the clock radio alarm as there wasn't a radio in the room. There was no TV channel listing on the remote, or on the TV menu making viewing a chore.The TV remote had to be returned when checking-out. This place served its purpose, but not a place to revisit.

HotelInfo.Name: Dunes Inn - Sunset
HotelInfo.Address: 5625 Sunset Blvd., Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90028
